programme.title: Gidget Grows Up
programme.desc: When her boyfriend leaves for the Air Force without calling, Gidget heads to New York in the name of world peace and joins the U.N. as a tour guide.

programme.title: First Comes Courage
programme.desc: Beautiful Norwegian woman Nicole Larsen (Merle Oberon) is dedicated to the local resistance movement, and seduces Nazi officer Paul Dichter (Carl Esmond) in order to gain information that will help to defeat the Germans. Complicating matters for Nicole are both the difficulty of her loathsome undercover work and the appearance of an old flame, handsome English soldier Allan Lowell (Brian Aherne), who would like nothing more than to reunite with her.

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared
programme.desc: When a kerfuffle over fine wine exports upends their tiny nation's economy, the prime minister and grand duchess of Fenwick declare war on the U.S.

programme.title: Tell It to the Judge
programme.desc: Marsha Meredith (Rosalind Russell) has just been offered a position as a federal judge. Much to her dismay, her nomination is challenged on the grounds that her divorce renders her unsuitable for the courtroom. Desperate to win the position, Marsha arranges a fake marriage to Alexander (Gig Young), even though she still has feelings for Peter (Robert Cummings), her ex-husband. Marsha and Alexander -- and Marsha and Peter -- soon find themselves in a series of compromising situations.

programme.title: Bell, Book and Candle
programme.desc: A Greenwich Village witch falls for her dashing neighbor. When she learns he’s engaged, she casts a love spell but risks losing her powers for good.

programme.title: You Belong to Me
programme.desc: Rich playboy Peter Kirk (Henry Fonda) crashes into Dr. Helen Hunt (Barbara Stanwyck) on a ski slope and overplays his injuries so she will continue her medical attention. He declares his love, and, although Helen insists that her career will always come first, the two get married. Soon, Peter is consumed by jealous suspicions of his wife's male patients and embarrasses Helen several times. Fearful of driving her away, Peter launches into character-changing behavior to prove his love.

programme.title: Beyond Mombasa
programme.desc: When his brother dies during a uranium mining mission in East Africa, a hard-drinking American makes his way there to suss out his killers.

programme.title: Queen Bee
programme.desc: A naive, working-class Chicagoan enters a world of bitter jealousy and manipulative power plays when invited to Atlanta by her socialite elder cousin.

programme.title: Diamond Head
programme.desc: A wealthy Hawaiian pineapple plantation owner and bigoted bully with political ambitions flatly refuses to allow his young sister to marry a native.

programme.title: Passport to Suez
programme.desc: Master sleuth Lone Wolf (Warren William) outwits Nazi spies for canal plans in Egypt.

programme.title: Duffy
programme.desc: A professional smuggler gets involved in a scheme by two half-brothers to steal a fortune from their wealthy father’s yacht in the Mediterranean.

programme.title: Brief Moment
programme.desc: Based on a play by S.N. Behrman.

programme.title: Run Wild, Run Free
programme.desc: A mute boy who spends his days roaming the English countryside starts coming out of his shell when he befriends a wild pony and a retired colonel.

programme.title: The Lone Wolf and His Lady
programme.desc: When a gem disappears from an exhibition, jewel-thief-turned-reporter Lone Wolf (Ron Randell) is accused.

programme.title: Born Free
programme.desc: An English couple in Kenya raises an orphaned lion cub to adulthood. When a warden demands she be sent to a zoo, they train her to live in the wild.

programme.title: The Notorious Landlady
programme.desc: After falling for his charming landlady, an American diplomat in London learns that she's suspected of murder and tries to help her clear her name.

programme.title: The Hard Man
programme.desc: A Texas Ranger (Guy Madison) turns deputy sheriff; a woman (Valerie French) wants him to kill her cattle-baron husband (Lorne Greene).

programme.title: A Tornado in the Saddle
programme.desc: Ranchers and a new sheriff (Russell Hayden) have trouble with a gold rush.

programme.title: Hangman's Knot
programme.desc: Major Matt Stewart (Randolph Scott) leads a troop of Confederate soldiers on a raid, targeting a wagon that is transporting Union gold. All of the Union soldiers are killed except for one, who informs Stewart that the war had already ended a month ago. Stewart leads the troop into hiding, knowing they could face murder charges. After capturing a coach driven by nurse Molly Hull (Donna Reed), the soldiers try to evade a group of bandits chasing them to steal the gold.

programme.title: Brave Warrior
programme.desc: Shawnee chief Tecumseh (Jay Silverheels) helps a government agent (Jon Hall) catch traitors before the War of 1812.

programme.title: Cowboy
programme.desc: A Chicago hotel clerk smitten with the daughter of a trail boss’s business partner goes on a cattle drive with him to Mexico through the real West.

programme.title: The Domino Kid
programme.desc: A Confederate veteran (Rory Calhoun) hunts to kill the five outlaws who ran off his cattle and shot his father.

programme.title: Scalplock
programme.desc: A frontier gambler (Dale Robertson) wins a railroad in a card game and has to keep it going as people try to take it away from him.

programme.title: Lust for Gold
programme.desc: During the 1870s, the ruthless Jacob Walz (Glenn Ford) becomes very wealthy after locating a legendary Arizona gold mine and securing sole ownership by murdering his partner. Walz then travels to Phoenix, where he catches the attention of a beautiful and crafty woman named Julia Thomas (Ida Lupino), who has learned of his exploits. Eventually, Walz falls in love with Julia, unaware that she's already married to Pete (Gig Young), who is eyeing his fortune.

programme.title: The Untamed Breed
programme.desc: Texas ranchers resist an out-of-towner (Sonny Tufts) who has a Brahman bull to breed.

programme.title: Return to Warbow
programme.desc: Three escaped convicts return to collect the money that the brother of one of them has already spent.

programme.title: Comanche Station
programme.desc: When solitary cowboy Jefferson Cody (Randolph Scott) hears tales of a white woman living as a captive of the Comanche tribe, he rides deep into the tribe's territory to exchange goods for her freedom. As Cody escorts the captive woman away, he learns that she is Nancy Lowe (Nancy Gates), and that there is a sizable reward offered by her husband for her return. Cody and Mrs. Lowe must brave ruthless bounty hunters greedy for the reward, as well as the now-warring Comanches, to make it to safety.

programme.title: Pecos River
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) and his singing sidekick (Smiley Burnette) catch mail robbers.

programme.title: The Last Rebel
programme.desc: Two Confederates (Joe Namath, Jack Elam) save a man's (Woody Strode) life and cause trouble in 1865 Missouri.

programme.title: Kazan
programme.desc: A Canadian government wildlife expert (Stephan Dunne) tames a white dog trained to fight by brutal masters.

programme.title: Jubal
programme.desc: Searching for work, cowboy Jubal Troop (Glenn Ford) arrives in a small town, where he badly injures his hand. Fortunately, a local rancher, Shep Horgan (Ernest Borgnine), is willing to employ Troop despite the injury. Horgan and Troop work together amicably, but Horgan's two-timing wife (Valerie French) threatens to create discord when she becomes interested in Troop, although he really loves another woman. A jealous cowhand (Rod Steiger) complicates matters by spreading lies.

programme.title: Jack McCall, Desperado
programme.desc: A lone gunslinger, Jack McCall (George Montgomery), bursts into a saloon and shoots dead the legendary Wild Bill Hickok (Douglas Kennedy). Arrested and put on trial, McCall recounts a twisted tale that paints Hickok as anything but heroic, explaining how Hickok and McCall's cousin Bat (James Seay) took over McCall's family's plantation, killed his parents and even framed him for crimes he didn't commit. McCall's cold-blooded killing of Hickok was warranted. Or was it?

programme.title: Land Raiders
programme.desc: An Arizona land-grabber (Telly Savalas) and his brother (George Maharis) renew their feud amid Army troops and Apaches.

programme.title: Phantom Stagecoach
programme.desc: A dispute between stage lines ends with a steel-armored stagecoach.

programme.title: The Pathfinder
programme.desc: Based on the novel of the same name, a scout is sent by the British to infiltrate a French stronghold near the Great Lakes in the 1750s.

programme.title: Montana Territory
programme.desc: A cowgirl vigilante (Wanda Hendrix) proves to a deputy (Lon McCallister) that the sheriff (Preston Foster) is an outlaw.

programme.title: California Conquest
programme.desc: A Spanish swashbuckler (Cornel Wilde) and a gunsmith's daughter (Teresa Wright) oppose a Russian plot to annex California.

programme.title: Adventures in Silverado
programme.desc: Based on the Robert Louis Stevenson book "The Silverado Squatters."

programme.title: Ridin' for Justice
programme.desc: A popular cowboy (Buck Jones) takes the blame for the death of a deputy who tried to force himself on the marshal's wife.

programme.title: Relentless
programme.desc: Framed for a murder he didn't commit, a cowboy hides with a traveling woman as he flees a sheriff and hunts for the real killer.

programme.title: Jesse James vs. the Daltons
programme.desc: An outcast rumored to be the son of notorious outlaw Jesse James makes contact with the Dalton gang in hopes of learning the truth about his lineage.

programme.title: Bonanza Town
programme.desc: A Western that’s chock-full of action and fights as a cowboy tries to collar a group of outlaws while a crooked judge does all he can to stop him.

programme.title: The Great Sioux Massacre
programme.desc: The story of Gen. Custer (Philip Carey) and the Little Bighorn is seen through the eyes of two of his subordinates (Joseph Cotten, Darren McGavin).

programme.title: Ride Lonesome
programme.desc: A bounty hunter escorts a killer to prison but allows his outlaw brother to catch up with them to have a showdown over a previous shocking murder.

programme.title: What Ever Happened To Baby Jane?
programme.desc: Two aging sisters are connected by mutual dependency, jealousy and hatred.

programme.title: What's Up, Doc?
programme.desc: When suitcases are mixed up, a chase across San Francisco follows.

programme.title: Jeremiah Johnson
programme.desc: An 1830s loner leaves civilization and learns how to be a mountain man.

programme.title: Bowery Boys: Bowery Bombshell
programme.desc: When one of the Bowery Boys is photographed in front of a bank during a robbery, he becomes a suspect.

programme.title: Bowery Boys: Jinx Money
programme.desc: After the Bowery Boys find a dead gambler's money, they're soon pursued by the mob and police.

programme.title: Bowery Boys: Live Wires
programme.desc: In the first Bowery Boys film, the boys take on gangsters from a construction company.

programme.title: Bowery Boys: News Hounds
programme.desc: The Bowery Boys become undercover newspaper journalists and investigate a ring of gamblers.

programme.title: Bowery Boys: In Fast Company
programme.desc: The Bowery Boys get into the taxicab business and fight a conniving rival cab company.

programme.title: Bowery Boys: Hard Boiled Mahoney
programme.desc: The Bowery Boys accidentally become private detectives, and their investigation uncovers a fraudulent psychic.

programme.title: Bowery Boys: Angels in Disguise
programme.desc: The Bowery Boys go undercover to catch some unruly gangsters.

programme.title: Bowery Boys: Smuggler's Cove
programme.desc: After one of the Bowery Boys inherits an estate on Long Island, the crew face a German gang of smugglers.

programme.title: Abbott and Costello Meet Captain Kidd
programme.desc: Abbott and Costello are on an island with deadly pirates.

programme.title: Wild Rovers
programme.desc: Cowboy Ross Bodine decides to join his buddy in robbing a bank to finance a comfortable retirement.

programme.title: Marie Antoinette (1938)
programme.desc: Lavish biography of the French queen who "let them eat cake."

programme.title: Time After Time
programme.desc: When Jack the Ripper steals his time machine, H.G. Wells tracks him down.

programme.title: The Super Cops
programme.desc: Two New York cops are sent to a crime-ridden section of Brooklyn, where they develop their own bizarre and amusingly extreme methods of fighting.

programme.title: The Outfit
programme.desc: After unknowingly robbing a syndicate bank, an ex-con demands $250,000 from the mob to avenge his brother's death in a dangerous quest for justice.

programme.title: The Tunnel of Love
programme.desc: A married couple endures endless red tape when they try to adopt a child.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Robin Hood
programme.desc: In this swashbuckling classic, the legendary hero fights to rid England of the tyranny of Prince John and win the love of the beautiful Maid Marian.

programme.title: The Corn Is Green
programme.desc: Bette Davis stars as a schoolteacher determined to help the people of a turn-of-the-century Welsh mining town.

programme.title: Gunga Din
programme.desc: Helped by their valiant water carrier, three British soldiers face off against a Thuggee religious cult on a dangerous mission in 1880s India.

programme.title: Finian's Rainbow
programme.desc: A leprechaun follows an Irishman who stole his pot of gold to the US South.

programme.title: An American in Paris
programme.desc: Gene Kelly sings and dances his way through Paris as a WWII veteran.

programme.title: The Falcon's Alibi
programme.desc: A society sleuth sets out on the trail of a society matron's lost jewels.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Evidence suggests that the man responsible for saving a lieutenant's life is a soldier who was captured in Afghanistan.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Special Agent Pride and the team uncover a domestic drug ring -- led by Sonja's childhood friend, Marion Watkins (Samaire Armstrong), that is producing cocaine.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A children's magic show goes horribly wrong when one of the performers dies during a trick. Barnaby and Jones discover that the victim was poisoned with a rare toxin extracted from Ecuadorean poison frogs - so the hunt is on for a particularly ruthless and imaginative killer. The detectives soon learn that a feud is raging between local occult practitioner Ernest Balliol and famous writer Aloysius Wilmington. While some of the villagers - such as Ernest's daughter Isolde - believe that powerful magical forces are at play, others think the reasons for the bloodshed may have their roots in the distant past. Barnaby and Jones soon find themselves delving into the occult, magic, and ancients books of power, to determine what happened, and soon sense a mixture of both might be the motive for the murder, when a book shop owner is killed with shattered glass, laced in the same poison.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones are forced to take part in a team building exercise and Tom has plenty of problems dealing with the young, new, acting Chief Superintendent, John Cotton (Nick Fletcher). Following an explosion in a truck that had been stored in a truck depot, a body is soon discovered in a nearby lake, which turns out to be Alec Grainger, who had been seen arguing with James Parkes (Joseph Millson), the son of Colonel Matt Parkes (Tim Pigott-Smith). James appears to be involved in shady business deals and is blamed by his grandmother Caroline Halsey (Judy Parfitt) - and others - for the suicide of a woman he got pregnant two years before. Barnaby and Jones find themselves delving into a mixture of fraud, smuggling, and lies, trying to piece together the truth.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio finally learns the truth about what happened to his brother, and the repercussions will change his life forever.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio finds himself with a price on his head when he makes plans to shut down the illegal smuggling operation of one of Miami's fiercest gangs.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A rich couple's daughter dies when the family is trapped on a burning yacht in shark-infested waters.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: When a teenage tourist goes missing, the team investigates the dark side of Miami's nightclub scene.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Evidence suggests that a confessed killer is actually innocent; Horatio works to collar the actual culprit before the man falls victim to the system.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Three suburban housewives on a weekend in Miami are the prime suspects when their hotel's handsome pool boy is found murdered.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: When a woman Horatio has been dating is murdered and he is the last one to see her alive, the team tries to learn who would have the motive and the method to frame him.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A convicted murderer escapes and begins to kill again, and the assailant's original arresting officer, Mac Taylor (Gary Sinise), comes to help Horatio Caine recapture the felon.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Ryan's life is in jeopardy when the team is caught in the midst of a deadly divorce case.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team searches for a group of video gamers that has started to play the game in real life, killing police officers, stealing evidence, raping women, and robbing a bank.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio and his team investigate the murder of a suspected drug lord as one member of the group is arrested for buying marijuana.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: New technology helps find the true rapist in a cold case, but he is murdered before he can go to trial.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A man is murdered while trying to learn how to pick up women at a hip Miami nightclub.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: When a female executive is shot at an afternoon concert, the evidence leads the team to suspect that the dreaded Mala Noche gang has struck again.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Evidence shows that a series of murders is linked to organized crime, but it also leads Horatio and the team to a pair of film students whose screenplay mirrors the details of the crimes.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: When a body is found during a beach volleyball tournament, the evidence leads Horatio to his nemesis, Walter Resden, who is now targeting a person Horatio has sworn to protect.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A convicted child molester is found murdered in Alexx's neighborhood.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: As their murder investigation intensifies, Horatio must ask Natalia to reveal a secret from her past to help solve the case.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: When a corpse is recovered, the team finds evidence against a man formerly vindicated of killing his wife and dumping her body in the ocean.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio must protect Marisol when her life is threatened after she witnesses a robbery.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac and the team reunite with the Coltons, a family of bounty hunters, as they all search for a thief of classified intelligence.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: As Mac and the team investigate the suspicious death of Dawn's CIA supervisor, the evidence leads to a dirty CIA agent and a massive counterfeiting ring.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac and Jack attempt to rescue a billionaire's son after he is kidnapped by a former Navy SEAL.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: While helping a friend in Puerto Rico, MacGyver is taken hostage by robbers who are attempting to steal $2 million from the bank his friend manages.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Mac and Riley are called in to examine a mysterious object that crash-landed in the Nevada desert; Riley uncovers new information about Mac's father but questions whether to deliver it to him after he says he needs to move on.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: MacGyver gets a shocking surprise when he tries to tell Matty he's quitting the Phoenix Foundation.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Three months after quitting the Phoenix Foundation and moving to Nigeria, Mac puts aside his differences with his father and returns when he hears Jack is the target of a murderous dictator he double-crossed.

programme.title: MacGyver
programme.desc: Jack receives an emergency distress signal from one of his old Delta buddies who has been accused of terrorism in a foreign country; MacGyver and Jack quickly recruit the rest of Jack's old Delta team and stage an unsanctioned rescue operation.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU investigates when several federal government employees, including a close friend of Walker's, succumb to symptoms of a heart attack; Reid anxiously awaits his trial date.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When Reid fears his mother has been abducted, he asks the BAU to investigate while he's stuck in prison.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Morgan brings the BAU new information in the case against Mr. Scratch, a serial killer and escaped convict who has been wreaking havoc on the team.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Agent Matt Simmons joins the BAU team in a race to take down Mr. Scratch and save one of their own in the process.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU investigates three similar crimes in which victims' remains are discovered in old suitcases.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When an anger-driven, unknown subject targets successful businessmen in Detroit, the BAU must investigate.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU investigates a workplace shooting committed by a state-of-the-art drone in Silicon Valley.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Morgan returns to the BAU to help Penelope deal with a case that has affected her emotionally.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU must find out what several missing women have in common to find them.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The BAU searches for a subject who is targeting prominent members of the community.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is not convinced about Mayor David Hicks' plans to revive an annual trip to Brighton, suspecting his proposal to buy coastal land there, is rather a fraudulent scheme. Naturally, he joins the trip, but during their time in Brighton, a hated property developer (Tim McInnerny) is beheaded on a ghost house ride, prompting Barnaby to team up with his cousin to determine whether the developer's renters, the mayor, a gloomy reverend (Mark Gatiss), or the lady of a large estate are responsible, and soon discovers a hotbed of jealously, debt, lies and more, conceal a far darker secret.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Ford Florey is a town with a Wild West Society and many grudges. During a Wild West show at the local faire, the witch on the 'Dunk the Witch' stall is well and truly dunked but laughter soon turns to horror when she doesn't get up and the water in the tank starts to turn red. Barnaby and Jones need to be quick on the draw to track down the murderer, and soon begin to wonder whether a dispute over land was the motive, or something far more sinister, especially when more people are killed, with methods linked to the Wild West.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: On a dark night in the village of March Magna, Barnaby's wife Joyce swerves her car and narrowly misses a shadowy figure in the road - or so she thinks, when later that night a body is discovered in the old cemetery. The victim was a member of the council who was strange and weird, but someone seemed to have quite a grudge on him, and so Barnaby and Jones delve into his background, and the village, attempting to determine who might have wanted him dead, finding ghosts, grudges, and more beneath the village's surface.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Piano student Zoe Stock has won a place at the Devington Manor Winter School led by internationally renowned musician, Sir Michael Fielding (James Fox). Yet when she is there, things become mysterious when from the river bank in the grounds of the manor she sees a woman jump from the bridge and disappear underwater. When Barnaby and Jones start investigating the possible drowning, they discover unsavoury connections to the past that could prove lethal 20 years later, especially when someone attempts to kill. It isn't long, before murder does occur, and the detectives attempt to fathom what occurred in the drowning, and the present day murders.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Midsomer Morchard's very own boxer, John Kinsella, wins a world title in New York, the success seems to be a joyous time for all, until murder rears its ugly head. When a local solicitor is found dead by his assistant and Kinsella's manager, Barnaby attempts to determine what is going on, and soon discover issues with inheritance, affairs, anger, and gambling to make matters difficult. Meanwhile Kinsella's trainer Teddy Molloy (Phil Daniels) has his own hidden agenda. When a re-enactment of a Victorian boxing match gets heated, and Kinsella's manager is found dead in his home's gym, the pair attempt to determine who is responsible, although Barnaby's judgement seems to be clouded on this one.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A planning dispute turns to murder, after a leading light in the Midsomer Conservation Society suspects her neighbours are involved in a money-making development scam. Political wrangling, burglaries and sexual liaisons abound in picturesque Great Pelfe - but when a member of the possible scam is themselves murdered, Barnaby wonders what is truly going on behind the scenes of an important by-election.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby reluctantly accompanies Joyce on a spa weekend to Swavely Manor. But as he attempts to de-stress, a woman is found dead in the flotation chamber. He abandons his treatment to investigate, but his personal worries are never far away as he contemplates his future, while trying to determine if an argument between the spa's owners and their neighbours is the motive, or something else.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the Barnabys prepare for Cully's wedding, Lord Fitzroy and Beth Porteous are married in the pretty village of Bledlow. At the lavish reception at Bledlow Hall that follows, however, tragedy strikes - maid of honour Marina Fellowes is found murdered in one of the rooms by some of the guests. With their honeymoon cancelled, the Fitzroys must contend with a police presence in their home, as Barnaby and Jones try to learn more about the family history. It soon becomes clear there are secrets, deception, and an illegtimate son involved in the mystery, which is further complicated when the estate manager is killed by an arrow.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: It's a good day for the Hicks family, as the name of Tommy Hicks - who was executed during World War I for "cowardice and desertion" - is added to the list on Midsomer Parva's war memorial. Tommy's son Lionel and grandson Dave, mayor of Causton and whom Barnaby does not like (owing to dodgy building work by the mayor's company), are thrilled, but the snooty Hammonds are decidedly less pleased. Henry, the patriarch of the Hammond family, is particularly riled by his insalubrious neighbours, and has nurtured a long-running feud with the Hickses. But the evening after a battle re-enactment in the village, Henry is murdered - and Barnaby must delve into the history of the two families to find the killer, discovering a web of fraud, lies, and hidden truths.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones are in Dunstan to investigate the deaths of a reclusive couple. As they try to establish whether Ron and Libby Wilson were murdered or died of natural causes, their attention is drawn to a dispute raging between a local builder and road protesters nearby. When another death occurs, the detectives learn that there are plenty of dark secrets and fierce hostilities in this apparently idyllic village. Will Jack Purdy's quick temper lead to violence? How far would the protesters go to prevent the bypass being built? And do current events somehow relate to the death of Michael Wilson many years earlier?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the body of Londoner Charlie Finleyson is discovered in woodland near Midsomer Sonning, Barnaby and Jones find themselves investigating employees at local Midsomer Life magazine. It turns out the dead man was married to the ex-wife of Guy Sandys, the wealthy owner of the publication. As the detectives become aware of a feud between Guy and the proprietor of the Morecroft Hotel, tensions are also heating up between the locals and visiting Londoners. Soon Barnaby and Jones find themselves to trying to piece together the truth about the murder, and learn that someone might be trying to conceal something in their past.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a pub landlady is crushed to death during a magic show in Midsomer Oaks, Barnaby and Nelson uncover conflict between the village church and ancient pagan traditions. Is famous magician Gideon Latimer to blame or is he the target?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones are forced to take part in a team building exercise and Tom has plenty of problems dealing with the young, new, acting Chief Superintendent, John Cotton (Nick Fletcher). Following an explosion in a truck that had been stored in a truck depot, a body is soon discovered in a nearby lake, which turns out to be Alec Grainger, who had been seen arguing with James Parkes (Joseph Millson), the son of Colonel Matt Parkes (Tim Pigott-Smith). James appears to be involved in shady business deals and is blamed by his grandmother Caroline Halsey (Judy Parfitt) - and others - for the suicide of a woman he got pregnant two years before. Barnaby and Jones find themselves delving into a mixture of fraud, smuggling, and lies, trying to piece together the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When two couples vanish into thin air in the village of Monks Barton, Barnaby and Jones hear rumours of haunted woods and witchcraft. Barnaby remains sceptical of this, even when an unidentified body is found in a shallow grave and the missing start turning up dead. He soon has to determine if ghosts, criminals, or something else, is behind the abductions and murders.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Troy tackle two separate cases as Troy prepares to leave Midsomer after his promotion to DI.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby's new Sergeant arrives on the day after the murder of a local shrew occurs, and he is immediately put to work.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Long-suppressed family secrets, stolen ancient artefacts, and a thirty year old death at a Celtic burial site result in a series of murders in present day Midsomer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The best of the best go head to head in Houston, Texas; six-figure custom vehicles are sold to the bidders with the strongest stomachs and coolest heads.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Barrett-Jackson is thrilled to be back in Scottsdale, Ariz., to celebrate its golden anniversary; 50 Years of camaraderie, commotion and cars and Barrett-Jackson shows no sign of slowing down.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Another day at the Barrett-Jackson auction provides buyers of all budgets and interests with lots of choices, such as as restorations, moderns, customs, trucks and more.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: From a 1971 Custom Chevy C-10 Deluxe Pick-Up all the way to a 1984 AM General M923 6x6, there is an option for every pick-up lover.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: The 'Stangs take on the 'Vettes with examples from across all eras, and a few Thunderbirds and Plymouths thrown in for good measure.

programme.title: Barrett-Jackson: REVVED UP
programme.desc: Barrett-Jackson shifts into high gear with more incredible highlights from the 2022 Las Vegas auctions; classics and customs cross the block, bringing top dollar from bidders betting it all.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: A battle erupts when Oakes is accused of stealing Rygaard's logs; tensions soar as a runaway log nearly wipes out the crew in Alaska; Shelby brings out his puppy to help him with a special assignment; Swilley gets snagged underwater.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby and his new hand hit pay dirt with one of the biggest logs of the season; Coatsy's misstep in the yarder puts the crew in danger; the Dreadknots reunite and take the fight directly to Chapman's home turf.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: In Washington, the crew nearly topples the yarder; a drastic toothache remedy; Chapman races a storm in Florida.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Rygaard and Oakes are forced to share the same landing; Shelby gets in hot water with the law over a contested log; Joe and Coatsy struggle to get the Papac crew back on track; the Dreadknots have a run-in with Fish and Wildlife.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The end of the season approaches; a boat crash stops Shelby in his tracks; Gabe's crew does a favor for Oake's crew, to his dismay.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: A chainsaw accident leaves the crew short-handed; Jason flips a loaded trailer; Shelby finds out if he filled his board foot order.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: In Washington, Rygaard goes deep into their roughest terrain yet in an attempt to recapture the title; in Alaska, Papac's dreams of a repeat are shattered when Coatsy's badly injured; in Canada, a new candidate steps into the ring.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: In Alaska, the Papac team struggles to find someone to fill the shoes of injured Coatsy; Gabe Rygaard and his crew scramble to make up for their slow start; In Wyoming, David Zitterkopf and Sons keep their chainsaws humming.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: In Alaska, Papac initiates an extremely dangerous process called Shotgun Logging; in Wyoming, the Zitterkopf men take the Bear Ranch site by storm; at Rygaard, the team doubles the yarders to increase production.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby uses an airboat to search for century-old logs; Rygaard attempts to move a six-ton cypress; David's sons hold down the fort while he delivers a load of logs to the mill; the Dreadknots suffer a late-day accident.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby tries to repair his custom-made buggy; David Zitterkopf makes a dangerous swing between trees; the Dreadknots go logging in the night; Triack is at a disadvantage when a crew member is injured.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Louisiana, Shelby and his assistant Bob go out looking for logs on his repaired swamp buggy; In Central Florida, the Chapman crew goes to fight against the legendary Gump log.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Shelby goes to Lake Ponchartrain with Belinda and Bob to obtain a huge log he marked years ago; In Florida, it's round two for the Chapman and Gump log; things go from bad to worse for the bare bones Rygaard crew.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Rygaards go old school to keep the team on track; Shelby and Bob find a valuable sinker cypress; the Zitterkopf crew tries to take on a dangerous tangle of logs known as "the teepee of death."

programme.desc: Brandi and Jarrod discover an illuminating stash; Dave does what he does best; Mary finally gets the help she needs.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Kenny tries to bribe the competition in Canyon Country and becomes more worldly as a result; Ivy and Isaiah make the most of their purchase; Brandi takes on the powers of darkness.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Brandi wakes up on the wrong side of the bed but feels much better after picking up a locker in Placentia; Rene goes to the office to quickly flip his money; Kenny struggles just to get through his unit, which seems to have it in for him.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers try their luck at a new facility in La Habra, where Ivy decides to teach them a lesson; Dusty brews himself up an interesting unit, while Kenny weighs the value of childhood memories when selecting a locker.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy dons his bright white lucky sneakers in Van Nuys; Brandi and Lisa's friendship is tested as they go head-to-head on a pair of lockers; Kenny sets his fears aside and takes the plunge on a unit that might just immerse him in profit.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry shows up to the auction ready to learn, bringing along a present for a certain hustler; Brandi and Bozek get a firm grip on a smaller unit that raises their spirits; Ivy treats his son to a birthday locker.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene gets lukewarm results bobbing for profits in Stanton; Dusty finds a hoard of quality equipment, inking himself a decent payday; looking for treasure, Brandi ends up with the green in an unexpected manner.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Ivy takes on a supervisory role in Stanton, and it leads him to a bit of Slavic success; Brandi tries to help Danielle outfit her new apartment; Lisa gambles on a painting.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi have fun as they try to dunk the competition; Casey tries her hand at bidding; Ivy turns his store into an auction house.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank are stunned by a house with storefronts frozen in time, containing a bounty of new-old stock and a secret bootlegging basement.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys go see a woman overwhelmed by an incredible inheritance, she opens the doors to a secret vault; they meet their match in an 80-year-old rebel who speeds a mini bike around his massive property.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: A Colorado property turns out to be a mega-pick; the guys visit a one-of-a-kind classic car collection; Danielle lines up a potential buyer for the rare Fiat cutaway car the guys shipped back from Italy.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: A lead on an ultra-rare VW beetle ends up being a true barn find, but it'll take a heavy metal move to bring it home.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: In Texas, Mike raves over a Volkswagen bus that's been transformed into a hunting lodge on wheels; Frank finds a heirloom that re-ignites a high-school obsession.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Korie still in Africa, Willie and Jep must step in and supervise Bella's sleepover. When a couple boys play a prank on the girls, Willie and Jep prove to be the perfect chaperones for the task.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Korie challenges Willie to come up with a romantic gesture without spending any money. Missy and Jase compete to see who can find a girlfriend for Mountain Man.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase's hopes to win the inaugural Duck Commander Fishing Tournament is buoyed when he is able to enlist the help of legendary angler Bill Dance. Meanwhile, Willie's vanity over his greying beard leads him to make a questionable decision.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase and Jep make a deal with Mia and Merritt to get them to go dove hunting with them. Si tries to make some extra cash by starting a West Monroe tour.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jumping Asian carp have invaded Monroe's waters so Jase and the guys set out to try to stop them from spreading further. Meanwhile, Willie and Si have to run Willie's Duck Diner for the day.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The family spends a weekend at their childhood summer camp, reliving old memories and working to repair a tennis court Willie built twenty years ago. While at the camp, Jep tries to pass a lifeguard swimming test he failed as a teenager.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Rowdy's adoption is finalized and he officially becomes a Robertson. Jase gets his first massage and enjoys it more than he expected.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Willie and Jase lose Si's tea cup, Si makes them go to great lengths to find it. When the entertainment for Gus's 1st birthday party falls through, Jep fills in as a magician.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie, Korie, Jase and Missy take dance lessons from Sadie to prepare for Reed and Rebecca's upcoming weddings. Jase's plan to perform Reed's wedding ceremony may fall through when he waits until the last minute to renew his ordainment.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Si decides to retire to pursue a music career, the family organizes a party in his honor. Meanwhile, Willie, Phil and Jase take a road trip to try to recreate an old duck call for Si's retirement gift. (Surprise performance from ZZ Top!)

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Phil decides to teach his grandkids the value of a hard day's work by building a football field and culminating in a family football game. But Robertson vs. Robertson competition is further sparked.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After a big order comes in Willie pushes the Duck Commander team to meet the tight deadline, so Jase and the warehouse guys come up with a plan to build a conveyer belt.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Brotherly competition gets the best of Willie when he ditches his kids' career day to go play golf with Jase. Stepping in for Willie, Phil and Si show up at the school and become the teachers' worst nightmare.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After blowing up one of Phil's dangerously antiquated duck blinds, the Robertson boys hatch a wild plan to build a luxury duck blind in the sky. Meanwhile, Ms. Kay and the Robertson women hold a yard sale.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase feels being COO of Duck Commander entitles him to a new office. But when Willie refuses, Jase hatches a plan to build one anyhow. Willie takes Miss Kay and the grandkids to the petting zoo.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's duck blind maintenance time again and the boys have discovered the waterline is low. At the levee, they realize this is the work of Phil's bucktoothed arch nemesis...THE BEAVER.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's the 40-year anniversary of Duck Commander and this celebration is a redneck Robertson style shindig. To top off the event, Willie decides to construct the world's largest duck call to be revealed at the party.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: To prove once and for all who rules the river AND the boardroom, Willie and Jase revive their childhood rivalry and go head-to-head in a fishing competition with the added challenge of having to sell their catch.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: While out duck hunting, Willie, Jase, and Uncle Si stumble across what redneck's consider nature's most prized succulent treasure--a beehive dripping with wild honey.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie finds out that his daughter Sadie has a new boyfriend, he wants to get to know him, while instilling some fatherly fear--Robertson style.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie decides to expand the Duck Commander brand into the winemaking industry and buys a vineyard...sight unseen.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase volunteers to take the Duck Commander RV out on pick up, but neglects to mention to Willie, he's taking Si, Martin and Jep along for a road trip.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase and Si embark on a turkey hunt for the annual Robertson men vs. Robertson women cook-off to create a feast of fresh wild game. With Phil's discerning palate as judge, the teams pull out all of the stops.

programme.desc: A compilation of the best scenes from all 11 seasons of A&E's hit series Duck Dynasty.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A compilation of the best scenes from all 11 seasons of A&E's hit series Duck Dynasty.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Sadie's (Willie's daughter) driver's license test fast approaching, she finds herself in dire need of lessons.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Willie's son (John Luke) leaves Willie's pickup in the driveway with a bone-dry gas tank, Willie and Korie decide that it's time to get the kid his own car.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Duck Commander assembly room gets an unexpected shakeup when a disgruntled Si decides to quit his job. But when Willie hires a replacement that clashes with the duck call room, Jase and the guys quickly become equally miserable at work. Meanwhile, Si turns to Phil for work out on the land turning a routine levee repair into a complete disaster.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie finds his office in shambles and alerts the authorities that the warehouse has had a break in. But soon Willie discovers that the culprit was his brother Jase, who needed supplies for an early morning frog hunt.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When a heat wave envelops West Monroe the air conditioning unit at the Duck Commander warehouse goes down, turning the duck call assembly room into a boiling sweatshop.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Korie decides the junk piles in the Duck Commander warehouse are beginning to reach critical mass, she calls on Willie and the guys to do a little company spring-cleaning. But the discovery of an old Ping-Pong table deep within the clutter quickly turns the chore into an all day table tennis tournament. Meanwhile, Uncle Si realizes that he's many years overdue for an appointment with the local eye doctor and ventures out for some new glasses.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After attending a local radio show as a guest, Willie sees an opportunity to host a show of his own. When the station gives him the opportunity, Willie makes the mistake of bringing Uncle Si on the air with him.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Jase, Si and the guys from the duck call room take a field trip to a brand new local donut shop and quickly find out who amongst them can eat the most delicious treats.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie receives a special gift from a Japanese business associate - a "priceless" samurai sword, which Willie keeps out of the hands of Jase and the guys.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie pushes his work force too far after implementing new "motivational work tactics," and the guys rise up against him and go on strike.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When NASCAR sensation Clint Bowyer pays a visit to the Duck Commander warehouse, Willie and the guys are fired up to spend the day hanging out with the professional racecar driver. But too much enthusiasm about the celebrity's mode of transportation turns into a drag race showdown between Willie and Clint. Phil and Si have their hands full fixing Ms. Kay's barbecue when a trip to the outdoor grill store turns disastrous.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's Willie's turn to play Santa Claus at the local church this year but Uncle Si crashes the party and the event goes south in a hurry. Meanwhile, the family gathers at Phil and Miss Kay's house to celebrate the holidays in true redneck fashion.

programme.desc: In this special two-hour episode the Abby Lee Dance Company prepares for a group number that is a tribute to Rosa Parks.

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: Kelly is livid when Abby pulls Brooke from this week's competition due to her less than stellar performance in the "Rosa Parks" group number.

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: The arrival of a new dancer at the Abby Lee Dance Company has Melissa and Mackenzie on guard. Abby, still hurting over the loss of her dog Broadway Baby.

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: In this patriotic episode, Abby assigns the girls dances inspired by the political state of America, but all is not fair in politics... especially in the dance world.

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: Abby's announcement of her guest-hosting gig on "The View" brings out the competitiveness.

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: The team hits the Big Apple not only for a competition, but also for a very special surprise. Abby has been invited to co-host "The View."

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: In this special two-hour episode, Abby and the Candy Apples go head-to-head at The Masters of Dance in New York City.

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: In this one-hour special, Abby Lee Miller introduces us to her mother, shares their amazing bond and history, with a revelation that will leave viewers awestruck.

programme.desc: Abby has not gotten over Cathy hitting her with her purse.

programme.desc: Abby's decision to have Maddie and Chloe dance the exact same solo shocks the moms and promises to finally prove who is the best dancer at the Abby Lee Dance Company.

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: Last competition, Cathy lost to Abby and was forced to kick a traitor out of her studio. This week, she is determined to rebuild her team and the trust she once had.

programme.desc: The pressure is on for Candy Apple's team and no one's spot is guaranteed. Rick is worried when Jalen is assigned his first contemporary solo.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin gets some unusual cars coming through the door of his work shop, but when a customer from California arrives with a '63 Rambler wagon and tells Joe he can do what he wants with it, he decides to go to town with a radical custom job.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin loves Novas and his eyes light up when a new customer, Eric, wants him to customize a 1972 as a tribute to his brother, if they can find one; Shag and Amanda hunt down a '71, in what appears to be mint condition.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin and his crew are always under the gun, but their latest build, a '71 Nova, is well behind schedule and they have a ton of work to do; Joe is really going to town on the metal work on this car, inside and out.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The Martins face the challenge of trying to fit a 6'5" former football player into the cab of a 1967 Chevy C10, requiring customization of the firewall, motor, frame and interior.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Facing deadline, the shop struggles to fit a gigantic ex-NFL player into a tiny 1967 Chevy C10 that includes a customized leather interior and automated bed cover.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe is pushing his engineering chops to the limit by building a monster trike that would look right at home on the set of a "Mad Max" movie.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Shag and Amanda get a '65 Chevy II Nova for a steal, but as the team digs in, rat nests and rust are the least of their worries; the build requires a complete overhaul and has them thinking they bit off more than they can chew.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Fitment issues in the engine bay leave the entire shop scratching their heads; Joe has big plans for the '65 Nova, but a small space to work with.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A customer wants to surprise his wife with major upgrades to her '68 Corvette convertible, but working with the fiberglass body soon brings on headaches that threaten both the car and the shop to crack under the pressure.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The clock is ticking to complete a 1968 Corvette convertible, but messy fiberglass repairs uncover major collision damage; and if that wasn't enough, the customer also wants an all-white interior, which isn't a good fit for such a dirty job.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A time capsule rolls into the shop in the form of a 1983 Silverado with exactly 69.2 miles on it; the owner recently passed away, and his daughter wants to finish turning his truck into a modern muscle car under the hood.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Amanda and Shag stumble upon a '73 Vega with a rich history and a seller anxious to see his car restored to glory; they plan to chop the top and add a enormous engine, but first they must tackle over 40 years of rust and grime.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin brings new life to old iron at his shop Joe Martin Customs; working with his wife Amanda, and best friend Shag, this custom shop oversees every phase of restoration from design, fabrication and mechanicals, to the final paint job.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A 1956 Ford truck has been sitting in a barn for more than 30 years; Joe and his crew fab up a hand-built custom frame, drop in a big power plant and make the interior smell like new leather.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The crew welds, grinds and hammers the frame and chassis of the barn-find '56 Ford truck; Joe uses all his tricks to make it look like it has been parked in a field for more than 50 years, but drive like a modern muscle machine.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The crew sinks their teeth into a legendary '77 Bandit Trans Am; a car of this stature calls for a big motor, meaty tires, low stance, steel spoilers, killer paint job and a brand-new interior; a '67 Chevelle returns for a supercharger engine.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe is deep into the rebuild of a '77 Bandit Trans Am; the car has a new frame, updated suspension and a new LS motor, but the T-Top is totally janky; it needs strengthening before this classic muscle car can get roaring down the road again.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: The crew checks another iconic car off their bucket list when they transform an iconic '70 Chevelle into a drag car. They make it MEAN with a monster motor, big tires, trick frame and a roll cage. But Joe dreams up a chopped roof at the 11th hour.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: It's open-car surgery as Joe and the team work to realize his dream of a cold-blooded '70 Chevelle race car with a chopped roof. Complications with the modified roof arise when the big-block monster motor obstructs driver visibility.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe stumbles across a '64 Ford Galaxie in great shape with only 60,000 miles on it. For Joe, it isn't enough to restore it to 1964, which means a trick frame with all-new steering, tires and a Coyote engine that will really make the car blast off.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Three years after a unicorn first rolled into the shop, Joe is more determined than ever to honor a 1936 Hudson owner's dying wishes to bring the car back to life; the ultimate Iron Resurrection will put Joe's exceptional metal skills to the test.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: In this corner, weighing in at only 2,400 pounds, the 1965 Ford Falcon! For a former professional wrestler, there isn't a better 50th birthday present than restoring this cult classic. For that, he puts his trust in Joe Martin & his world-class team.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A former customer has returned to the shop with a new project, a 1950 5-window Chevy truck. This isn't just any car in his collection, it's the crown jewel. To Joe's horror, this prized possession might have some seriously unsalvageable damage.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A '57 Chevy looks great, but the guys discover that looks can be deceiving.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin puts the finishing touches on the 1957 Chevrolet Bel Air and arranges for the car to be delivered to the owner; Joe uses all his tricks to prepare a Chevrolet C10 for a charity auction with a stylish paint job.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe and the team finish up the '51 Chevy 3100 Christmas-parade truck.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe and the team finish up the '51 Chevy 3100 Christmas-parade truck.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe dusts off his prized '65 Pontiac Catalina to give it the facelift it deserves -- new brakes, new trick frame and a bigger, badder LSA 600 horsepower motor. Meanwhile, Martin Bros. Customs tricks out the interior on an iconic 1932 Ford Roadster.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: With updates well underway on custom car guru Joe Martin's prized '65 Pontiac Catalina, Joe and the boys at Martin Bros. Customs give the ol' choppy-doo to a '41 DeSoto that has seen better days.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A longtime customer has his eye set on a car from Joe's personal collection, a 1967 Nova; Joe counters by offering up a 1966 Nova, with the guarantee that it will be twice the car Joe's is; big brakes, big power, big wheels and more.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe pulls out all the stops to make the '66 Nova the car of his client's dreams; Joe doesn't just want a mean motor and big tires; he wants a chopped roof, but the car might be too far behind schedule for a chop, even if it does up the cool factor.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A customer from New York entrusts Joe with his prized 1965 Buick Riviera.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe and the crew button up the 1965 Riviera's wiring, interior and paint.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The mayhem is back complete with its new 707hp drivetrain from a 2015 Dodge Charger Hellcat; the off-road Hornet; the Disgustang; the Crusher Impala; time for big action.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan built (or unbuilt) the Vette Kart: an '85 Chevy Corvette stripped to nothing but a chassis and powertrain; now, it's back and the guys try to execute the least-predictable stunt ever.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan drive the mid-engined, GMC Crew Cab, road-going dragster 500 miles to the Roadkill Zip-Tie Drags at Tucson Dragway.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Last time the guys tried to rescue this 1977 Chevy El Camino, the result was a transmission fluid spill that can still be seen from space; now it's back as the guys attempt a road trip to the Merrill Ice Drags on a frozen river in Wisconsin.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Building 440-powered Suzuki Samurai entirely out of a junkyard in Arizona.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Old fashioned, fun road trip in random, unreliable junk; David and Mike buy a 1966 Ford Econoline flat-face pickup, sight unseen, and hit the road.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike play around in hot-rodded pickups with a few friends.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan's loved Chargers since he was a kid; he recently bought a long-abandoned '68 Dodge Charger that's lasted 48 years in as-built condition; Finnegan works with buddies Tony Angelo, David Newbern and Daniel Boshears to bring it back to life.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Taking a 50-year-old car from a junkyard and motoring it to the 14,115-foot summit of Pikes Peak in Colorado.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David, Mike and Steve throw cars off a cliff at Glacier View in Alaska.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The Draguar makes an epic return all the way to racing at NHRA Nationals.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The Vanishing Paint Challenger is back with an upgraded suspension and it's ready to dominate the autocross; David Freiburger and Steve Dulcich enter Tire Rack SCCA Solo Nationals in Lincoln, Neb., a mere 1,700 miles away.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: It's a Roadkill challenge like no other; David Freiburger and Mike Finnegan are joined by Motor Trend hosts for an all-out war on tires.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike salvage a Road Runner that had an encounter with a pole.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike work on improving their Mazdarati mini-truck.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: For years Mike has wanted to build a 200-mph Cadillac, and now David has finally agreed to make it happen; they purchase a 1961 bubbbletop Cadillac deVille in Northern California; a Cadillac 500 engine wrapped inside a '73 AMC Gremlin.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike merge the front halves of two four-wheel-drive vehicles.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike attempt to fill the Mazdarati void with their new Econorado.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Steve built the Super Sammy, a junkyard-rescued Suzuki Samurai that they crammed a 440 Chrysler big-block into right where it sat in the middle of the junkyard; now they're back to find out why Suzuki never offered this engine combination.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike consider themselves masters of burnout-ology; yet they have never actually entered a burnout competition until now; they take a rusted-out '76 Camaro and set out across Texas to show how to scientifically get the best burnouts.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike take a 1964 Ford Galaxie 500 XL that absolutely needed to be rescued; after a few miles, the car begins to smoke worse than any car in the history of Roadkill.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike find beaters under $3K; it's a four-vehicle shootout with Chevy vs. Ford, truck vs. car, and old vs. newer; Freiburger chose a 2006 Crown Vic and a 1999 Chevy S-10; Finnegan went vintage with a 1972 Ford Maverick and a 1976 Chevy LUV.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Mike and David drive a new car every day as they trade their way through the 25th Hot Rod Power Tour; each day, they'll swap their junk for someone else's and try to make it to the next stop on the tour.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Steve finds a '71 Pontiac T-37 at a junkyard in Idaho; Mike and David take their time reviving a motor that's been sitting for 38 years.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Mike Finnegan and Tony Angelo buy a mid-1970s Chevy LUV mini-truck and hit the road, enduring electrical problems, torrential downpours, water in the engine, and floods.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The show goes back to its roots, but with a bigger map and a newer Dart.

programme.desc: David and Steve built the Super Sammy, a junkyard-rescued Suzuki Samurai that they crammed a 440 Chrysler big-block into right where it sat in the middle of the junkyard; now they're back to find out why Suzuki never offered this engine combination.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike consider themselves masters of burnout-ology; yet they have never actually entered a burnout competition until now; they take a rusted-out '76 Camaro and set out across Texas to show how to scientifically get the best burnouts.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike take a 1964 Ford Galaxie 500 XL that absolutely needed to be rescued; after a few miles, the car begins to smoke worse than any car in the history of Roadkill.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike find beaters under $3K; it's a four-vehicle shootout with Chevy vs. Ford, truck vs. car, and old vs. newer; Freiburger chose a 2006 Crown Vic and a 1999 Chevy S-10; Finnegan went vintage with a 1972 Ford Maverick and a 1976 Chevy LUV.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Mike and David drive a new car every day as they trade their way through the 25th Hot Rod Power Tour; each day, they'll swap their junk for someone else's and try to make it to the next stop on the tour.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Steve finds a '71 Pontiac T-37 at a junkyard in Idaho; Mike and David take their time reviving a motor that's been sitting for 38 years.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Mike Finnegan and Tony Angelo buy a mid-1970s Chevy LUV mini-truck and hit the road, enduring electrical problems, torrential downpours, water in the engine, and floods.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The show goes back to its roots, but with a bigger map and a newer Dart.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog, taking the day off to try his hand at coaching, assigns Tim and Leland to track down Emmanuel, a fugitive with terminal cancer who's got nothing to lose by running. Can the boys prove to Dog and Beth that they can handle a difficult job on their own?

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Once a criminal himself, Dog knows how it feels to be hunted. In this episode of our series that focuses on the tumultuous home and professional life of bounty hunter Dwayne "Dog" Chapman.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today's case involves a Samoan so Dog knows that the runner's close-knit kinfolk hold the keys to bringing him in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: This fugitive's sketchy associates and footloose ways spell trouble for Dog in today's hunt.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog juggles his job and family responsibilities at the same time. He leads the search for Robert, a low-level drug dealer who makes money by selling hedge clippings as marijuana and broken Macadamia nuts as crack.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog's time is running out in Colorado. After a month of helping his bail bondsmen friends around Denver, he's got to get his family back home to Hawaii. But Dog wants one more capture before they leave.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Baby Lyssa, who's just turned 18 and is studying to become a bondsman, gets to do some on-the-job training when she helps Dog hunt for Wayne, who's run out on a bond for second-degree assault.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: In a last ditch attempt to bring the team back together, Dog recruits his pastor, Tim Storey, to be the peacemaker.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog lectures high school students about the dangers of drugs before going after Joseph, a dangerous fugitive who won't be easy to capture. Dog gets special help from a UPS driver,

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: They say you can't teach an old dog new tricks but that's not the case with "Dog" Chapman. To his traditional bounty hunting tools of confidential informants, canvassing, and silver-tongued subterfuge the world's greatest bounty hunter has added Facebook!

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Two different young men; one has a taste for larceny, the other for strong sprits, both have a bad bad habit of missing their court dates.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog visits his mother's grave for inspiration before heading out to find Frankie, a violent fugitive hiding in the jungle.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and Duane Lee can't agree about what role Duane Lee should have in the family business, and the simmering tensions come to a head when Duane Lee is accused of denting Dog's SUV.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and company head to the Big Island in pursuit of two courthouse no-shows only to find that one of them appears to be posting status updates from Southern California.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog likes to say, "The apple doesn't fall far from the tree," and this is a hunt where that is true. So will Dog be able to use one family member's troubled ways to catch another one in trouble with the law?

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: With a long record of violence and abuse and weighing in at over 200lbs, Dog's target for the day does not sound like a gentle giant. When the trail grows cold Dog turns up the heat on the fugitive's brother and sister.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today's fugitive is accused of assaulting a police officer, so Dog and the team are not taking any chances. While on the Big Island and Dog convinces the felon's friends and family to join forces and then learns he has fled to another island.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: This hunt is personal. Dog's good friend and fellow bondsman Chris is running out of time. He has only days to find his fugitive or risk losing his business. In his hunt Dog confronts duplicitous tipsters, vicious attack dogs, and hostile neighbors.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Kimo does a vanishing act for his day in court and now Dog and the posse have to find him. With precious few leads to follow Dog turns to the fugitive's on again-off-again girlfriend, but she's initially reluctant to join the hunt.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Other than bringing criminals to justice, one of Dog's loves is teaching the next generation of bounty hunters the tricks of the trade. Today he has a new student.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog tries to nab a fugitive named Wayne by tricking him. Dog calls Wayne to tell him that he's won a new vacuum cleaner and he should stick around to get it.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog decides to sweep the island clean of as many fugitives as he can in two days. Raymond, wanted on drug charges, is an easy grab. Mauro, wanted for solicitation, is busted.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog has dropped Duane Lee from the team, and Leland is feeling caught in the middle. When Leland confronts Dog and Beth about the decision tempers flare.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: When an alleged abuser goes on the lame Dog gathers the team to bring him in. As the leads grow colder Dog's determination only grows stronger. Finally a hot lead comes in and Dog sets the trap for his prey.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It takes years to become a seasoned bondsman, and the tenderfoot Alysin has a lot to learn. She not only bailed out a man facing charges of theft on just his promise to pay the fee but also without a co-signer for his bond.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is in Colorado helping a fellow bondsmen clean up his files. The target today has a history of violence, and apparently plans to re-locate without notifying the proper authorities.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: With Duane Lee back on the team, the rift in the Chapman clan appears over. But will time heal this wound or make it worse?

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and the team get a big surprise after they track down Bosco, a fugitive who they believe is addicted to methamphetamines. They discover he's off drugs, settling into a normal life with a new girlfriend, and is very friendly.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Leland has a full plate of fugitives in Kona, and the whole family heads to the Big Island to help. They capture Clifford, who has a nasty habit of hitting his wife.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and his team fight the war on ice - crystal methamphetamine - on many fronts. They appear on a special anti-drug float in a parade. Then they go after bail-jumping Pana, a convicted drug dealer.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Hunting down a fugitive known as "Bozo," Dog gets help from an unexpected source - Bozo's father-in-law. When they find Bozo, he protests his wife-beating charge, saying he never hit her with his fist, only his open hand.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's Christmas day, and Dog sets out to nab Raymond, who robs to support his ice habit, and give him a little Christmas gift - shiny new handcuffs. A passerby in Chinatown tells Dog that Raymond's asleep on a park bench.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: While hunting an elusive deep sea fisherman, Dog is also trying to plan a great Mother's Day for Beth, but he's having problems finding the special flowers Beth wants.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog decides to liven things up with a competition. He and Beth will hunt for one fugitive, while Leland and Justin chase another.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Some of history's greatest tales are stories of escape, the most incredible of which defy explanation.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Deadly forests. Haunted houses. Mountains where visitors never return alive. Are there such things as "evil places"?

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Sunken ships filled with priceless cargo; lost cities of gold; ancient temples concealing untold riches; there's something about these hidden treasures that captures the human imagination.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: For thousands of years, people have believed in the existence of Satan, the embodiment of evil; some believe he has the power to possess souls and create mayhem amongst humanity.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Will we ever find the answers? Or, might these structures have been intentionally constructed to perpetually mystify us?

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Throughout history, many have believed that certain places, things, or even people can be tainted with dark curses. Ominous lakes that morph into watery graves.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Millions of people around the world claim to have had an encounter with a creature unlike any recognized by mainstream science.
